questions.question_text: Which attack works like a dictionary attack, but adds some numbers and symbols to the words from the dictionary and tries to crack the password?

discussion.content: The correct answer is A: Hybrid Attack. Reference: https://hashcat.net/wiki/doku.php?id=hybrid_attack
correct answer is A. Hybrid Attack

Selected Answer: A
It is Hybrid Attack

The correct answer is A. Hybrid Attack. A Hybrid attack combines the elements of a dictionary attack and brute force attack by adding random characters and numbers to a dictionary of pre-compiled passwords.
